CatDescriptText: Patricia Berger, Beltzhoover and Harold Griffin, poolroom operator, Fifth Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 2, 1960, pg. 25 with question "What is your opinion of the service rendered by the Pittsburgh Railways Company?  Do you think trolley fare rates should be increased?"  Mrs. Berger's answer reads: "The street car service from Castle Shannon and Library to Pittsburgh is real nice.  I don't think there should be a fare increase because it makes it too hard to get the change."  Mr. Griffin's answer reads: "Sometimes it is dependable and other times it is not.  Fare rates should not be increased.  The person working in such jobs as hospital work, just can't afford it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Patricia Berger wearing dark coat with plush collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Harold Griffin wearing dark shirt with plaid collar and dark cap, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
